intro: Tragacantha mesoptera, commonly known as the Mesopotamian tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces a resinous gum, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a binding agent. Tragacantha mesoptera thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in dry, rocky soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
